page.title: 02 WALK THROUGH BENTLEY PRIORY
page.content: Passing enormous detatched houses in a private drive we come to a track alongside the fence of R.A.F.Bentley Priory.See the huge bunkers being prepared for safety_but whose? We come upon an area of deciduous woodland and rough grassland known as Heriots Wood. Beech, Ash, Oak, Birch, Hawthorn, Blackthorn predominate_the Elms have all gone. See deer prints in the mud yet no sign of them. Woodland birds are plentiful- Thrush, Blackbird, Robin, Wren, Jay, Dunnock, Sparrow, Magpie, Crows and flocks of Tits. A large tract of common land from Stanmore Common to Harrow Weald Common- walks in all directions yet look out for the traffic on the main roads.It is lovely to escape the noise but the real world returns all too quickly.
